extends java.lang.Object

Usage: ExceptTrackHandler.setup(new BugSenseHandler.Processor() { boolean beginSubmit() { showDialog(DIALOG_SUBMITTING_CRASH); return true; } void submitDone() { cancelDialog(DIALOG_SUBMITTING_CRASH); return true; } void handlerInstalled() {} });

setup

public static boolean setup(Context context,
                            java.lang.String uniqueID)
Setup the handler for unhandled exceptions, and submit stack traces from a previous crash. Simplified version that uses a default processor.

Parameters:
context -

notifyContextGone

public static void notifyContextGone()
If your "Processor" depends on a specific context/activity, call this method at the appropriate time, for example in your activity "onDestroy". This will ensure that we'll hold off executing "submitDone" or "handlerInstalled" until setup() is called again with a new context.

Parameters:
context -

submit

public static boolean submit(ExceptTrackHandler.Processor processor)
Submit stack traces. This is public because in some cases you might want to manually ask the traces to be submitted, for example after asking the user's permission.

submit

public static boolean submit()
Version of submit() that doesn't take a processor.

setVerbose

public static void setVerbose(boolean verbose)
Tell us to be more verbose with respect to the log messages we output.

Parameters:
verbose -

setMinDelay

public static void setMinDelay(int delay)
When you are showing for example a dialog during submission, there will be situations in which submission is done very quickly the the dialog is not more than a flicker on the screen. This allows you to configure a minimum time that needs to pass (in milliseconds) before the submitDone() callback is called.

Parameters:
delay -

setHttpTimeout

public static void setHttpTimeout(java.lang.Integer timeout)
Configure a timeout to use when submitting stack traces. If not set the default timeout will be used.

Parameters:
timeout -

hasStrackTraces

public static boolean hasStrackTraces()
Return true if there are stacktraces that need to be submitted. Useful for example if you would like to ask the user's permission before submitting. You can then use Processor.beginSubmit() to stop the submission from occurring.

clear

public static void clear()
Delete loaded stack traces from memory. Normally, this will happen automatically after submission, but if you don't submit, this is for you.

isWifiOn

public static java.lang.String isWifiOn()
